TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit DeliveryRequirementsAttribute extends System.Attribute implements class System.ServiceModel.Description.IContractBehavior, class System.ServiceModel.Description.IContractBehaviorAttribute

Docs.summary: Specifies the feature requirements that bindings must provide to the service or client implementation.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the <xref:System.ServiceModel.DeliveryRequirementsAttribute> to instruct [!INCLUDE[indigo1](~/includes/indigo1-md.md)] to confirm that the binding provides the features required by the service or client implementation. If a <xref:System.ServiceModel.DeliveryRequirementsAttribute> attribute is detected when a service description is loaded from an application configuration file or built programmatically in code, [!INCLUDE[indigo2](~/includes/indigo2-md.md)] validates the configured binding and supports all the features that the attribute specifies. For example, your service may require the bindings to support queuing. Using <xref:System.ServiceModel.DeliveryRequirementsAttribute> allows [!INCLUDE[indigo2](~/includes/indigo2-md.md)] to confirm that the following requirements are met:
- The <xref:System.ServiceModel.DeliveryRequirementsAttribute.QueuedDeliveryRequirements%2A> property specifies the queuing requirements that a binding must meet.
- The <xref:System.ServiceModel.DeliveryRequirementsAttribute.RequireOrderedDelivery%2A> property indicates whether the binding must support ordered messaging.
- The <xref:System.ServiceModel.DeliveryRequirementsAttribute.TargetContract%2A> property indicates to which type the requirements apply.
The <xref:System.ServiceModel.DeliveryRequirementsAttribute> attribute is applied to a class, which can implement any number of service contract interfaces. <xref:System.ServiceModel.DeliveryRequirementsAttribute> can be applied to all the contracts the class implements or to only one of them. The attribute can be applied to a class more than once.
## Examples [!code-csharp[UEDeliveryRequirementsAttribute#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CFX/uedeliveryrequirementsattribute/cs/snippet1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[UEDeliveryRequirementsAttribute#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CFX/uedeliveryrequirementsattribute/vb/snippet1.vb#1)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The defaults are:
- The <xref:System.ServiceModel.DeliveryRequirementsAttribute.QueuedDeliveryRequirements%2A> property is set to <xref:System.ServiceModel.QueuedDeliveryRequirementsMode.Allowed>.
- The <xref:System.ServiceModel.DeliveryRequirementsAttribute.RequireOrderedDelivery%2A> property is set to `false`.

Docs.summary: Specifies whether the binding for a service must support queued contracts.
Docs.value: One of the values; the default is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.ServiceModel.QueuedDeliveryRequirementsMode.Required> instructs [!INCLUDE[indigo2](~/includes/indigo2-md.md)] to confirm that the binding supports queued delivery. The <xref:System.ServiceModel.QueuedDeliveryRequirementsMode.NotAllowed> value instructs [!INCLUDE[indigo2](~/includes/indigo2-md.md)] to confirm that the binding does not support queued delivery.
## Examples The following code example uses the <xref:System.ServiceModel.DeliveryRequirementsAttribute> attribute to instruct [!INCLUDE[indigo2](~/includes/indigo2-md.md)] to confirm at runtime that the actual binding does not support queued contracts but does support ordered messages.
[!code-csharp[UEDeliveryRequirementsAttribute#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CFX/uedeliveryrequirementsattribute/cs/snippet1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[UEDeliveryRequirementsAttribute#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CFX/uedeliveryrequirementsattribute/vb/snippet1.vb#1)]

Docs.exception: The value is not one of the values.

Docs.summary: Specifies whether the binding must support ordered messages.
Docs.value: instructs [!INCLUDE[indigo1](~/includes/indigo1-md.md)] to confirm that the binding must support the ordering of messages; otherwise, . The default is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks Setting the <xref:System.ServiceModel.DeliveryRequirementsAttribute.RequireOrderedDelivery%2A> property to `false` instructs [!INCLUDE[indigo2](~/includes/indigo2-md.md)] to perform no validation.
## Examples The following code example uses the <xref:System.ServiceModel.DeliveryRequirementsAttribute> attribute to instruct [!INCLUDE[indigo2](~/includes/indigo2-md.md)] to confirm at runtime that the actual binding does support ordered messages.
[!code-csharp[UEDeliveryRequirementsAttribute#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CFX/uedeliveryrequirementsattribute/cs/snippet1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[UEDeliveryRequirementsAttribute#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CFX/uedeliveryrequirementsattribute/vb/snippet1.vb#1)]

Docs.summary: Implements the method to enable validation support.

Docs.value: The to which the attribute applies.

remarks.format:
## Remarks A service class can implement any number of service contract interfaces. Use the <xref:System.ServiceModel.DeliveryRequirementsAttribute.TargetContract%2A> property to validate that endpoints with the <xref:System.ServiceModel.DeliveryRequirementsAttribute.TargetContract%2A> have bindings that support the requirements. This attribute can be used any number of times on the same class.
## Examples The following code example uses the <xref:System.ServiceModel.DeliveryRequirementsAttribute> attribute to instruct [!INCLUDE[indigo2](~/includes/indigo2-md.md)] to confirm at runtime that the actual binding does not support queued contracts but does support ordered messages. It also specifies the target contract to which this restriction should be applied.
[!code-csharp[UEDeliveryRequirementsAttribute#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CFX/uedeliveryrequirementsattribute/cs/snippet2.cs#2)] [!code-vb[UEDeliveryRequirementsAttribute#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CFX/uedeliveryrequirementsattribute/vb/snippet2.vb#2)]
